channel.title: Is it possible to learn rsps coding by playing with the client?
channel.description:
hey, it may seem like a stupid question but people learn by doing no? if i were to play around with codes and look up how to do different thing on a 307 or 508 could i learn how to code a server? I can code html5 and css3 pretry well, no pro but getting there, could i do it? thanks.
- jeff

item.title: Is it possible to learn rsps coding by playing with the client?
item.dc:creator: @F_A_I_L_S Fails
item.description:
@F_A_I_L_S wrote:

@op: i’m not sure why you want to learn java by programming rsps’s :P. but to answer your question, yes you can. however, you must learn the code and what its function is in order to be successful. i’d suggest downloading some ‘how-to’ docs. i believe there’s a post on here somewhere, cba to find it, called learn java in X days. you should try looking for it.

Read full topic
item.source: Is it possible to learn rsps coding by playing with the client?

the protocol yes

the java language itself no

item.source: Is it possible to learn rsps coding by playing with the client?

item.title: Is it possible to learn rsps coding by playing with the client?
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

halo pker:

witch is jacascript no? i can do a little bit of javascript

Okay, I see you have no programming knowledge.

JavaScript is a client sided scripting language for websites.
Java is a programming language used to develop applications.

They are both two different languages. You might be wonder why JavaScript has Java in the same, that is because JavaScript was built using Java.

I’d recommend you look up the bare basics of the language, this will help you a lot. There are many books, videos etc., teaching you Java online.

Read full topic
